content.description: Slave to the Grindstone is a good warm-up on some slab climbing. Start with your hands matched on the big jug below the left side of the slab. Move up on small hands and feet.
content.location: On the North East face of the boulder are a couple lines up a nice slab - this is the left of the two.

content.description: Terrible Two is a short, two move boulder problem in the chimney just downhill from the main Birthday Boulder. Start with matched hands on the big, obvious, flat, sloper hold. Move up to jugs at the top of the boulder. This would be 2 or 3 stars if it wasn't in the chimney gap, but it is. It is still a good problem, something to add to the warm-up circuit or to kill time while you wait for the sun to change aspect. There are a few other easy problems located on these blocks to do.
content.location: Just south/downhill from the main Birthday Boulder are two smaller boulders embedded in the hillside. This climbs out from the chimney/gap on the eastern boulder. Other easy boulder problems have been done on both of these blocks.

content.description: Start sitting on the far right side of the northwest face at a large, flat hold. Move up and left along some diagonal features to a large, striped hold. Proceed to the top. Crimpy climbing, large moves, and tricky beta make this the classic sandbag of the boulder.
content.location: Start on the rightmost side of the northwest face. Locate a big, flat shelf hold and diagonal features up through beautiful, copper colored rock.

content.description:
Critical Balance is another slabby route on the NE face of the boulder. Start right of '

To the Grindstone

' with your left hand on a good sidepull, and move with your right hand up to some nice compression holds. Pull up and over a small bulge onto the thin slab above, and go straight up.
content.location:
Just right of '

To the Grindstone

' on the Northeast face of the boulder, start below a small bulge.

content.description: Coffee and a Copper is another classic hard line on the impressive northwest face. Start with both hands on a large, flat, diagonal jug, and move more or less straight up the diagonal features.
content.location: Start in the middle of the northwest face at a big diagonal jug.

content.description: Cave Creatures is a lowball problem out of a small overhang. I'd give it one star due it being low to the ground, but there are some great moves and rock. Call out the dab police for this one.
content.location: On the south/south east corner of the boulder, this ascends a small overhang feature with some unfortunate rocks in the landing.

climbs.name: Bear Scar
climbs.fa: Stand (V6) D. Mckee. Sit Start, Ben Scott

content.description: Bear Scar is the classic North Routt problem. Perfect rock, hard moves to a stout crux, and an easier (but still engaging) highball finish make this a must do for the visiting boulderer. Squat start low on some bigger holds where two diagonal features create an 'x'. Big moves up and left towards the arete bring you to a long move up and right to an obvious, white sloper/crimper. Get this ,and hold on for the exciting topout straight up.
content.protection: A good number of pads and a spotter or two.
content.location: Start in a small pit on the northwest aspect of the boulder, just down and right from the aspen tree that grows close to the north arete. Check out the bear scars high on the tree for which this route is named.
